name: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION, Appellee, v. CHESTER-UPLAND SCHOOL DISTRICT SPECIAL BOARD OF CONTROL, Michael F.X. Gillin, B. Granville Lash and Adriene M. Irving, Appellants
name_abbreviation: Commonwealth v. Chester-Upland School District Special Board of Control

parties: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION, Appellee, v. CHESTER-UPLAND SCHOOL DISTRICT SPECIAL BOARD OF CONTROL, Michael F.X. Gillin, B. Granville Lash and Adriene M. Irving, Appellants.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
We hereby REVERSE the order of the Commonwealth Court granting appellee partial summary relief in the nature of a peremptory judgment in mandamus. This matter is REMANDED to the Commonwealth Court for an evidentiary hearing on the merits of appellee’s petition for review. See Camiel v. Thornburgh, 507 Pa. 337, 489 A.2d 1360 (1985); Commonwealth ex rel. Schaffer v. Wilkins, 271 Pa. 523, 115 A. 887 (1922).
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

casebody.head_matter:
911 A.2d 918
COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION, Appellee, v. CHESTER-UPLAND SCHOOL DISTRICT SPECIAL BOARD OF CONTROL, Michael F.X. Gillin, B. Granville Lash and Adriene M. Irving, Appellants.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Nov. 21, 2006.
